> The instances to pass on will be known and accessible in the primal
> TestSuite as it is invoked from within the IDE.

It the primal TestSuite has access to these ressources, you can store 
them into a static vector, the TestCases will then be able to access 
these ressources statically.

JUnit-addons library provides a (very simple) ResourceManager that does 
exactly this.  I'm using it with the textui.TestRunner and it works fine 
(if you're using the Swing runner, you will most likely have problems if 
you rerun the entire TestSuite, fix is welcome :-)).

hth

-Vladimir
